programme.title: Seasons of Saturn

programme.title: Virtual Universe
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Virtual Universe, S02E06, Our understanding of the cosmos is limited by the amount of time we have to see it. Fortunately, computer simulations can help us see how galaxies interact over millions of years, and even how dark matter structures the universe.

programme.title: Landing on Mars
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Landing on Mars, S03E06, Mars sparks our curiosity like no other planet because it is so reachable. Despite having landed there, most of the information we gather is still done by instruments in the planet's orbit.

programme.title: Cosmic Rays
programme.desc: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Rays, S04E04, Cosmic rays can tell us much about the universe. They are not simply another form of light, but carriers of information about powerful and unseen processes at work thousands or even millions of light years away.

programme.title: The Return (Part 2)
programme.desc: Stargate Atlantis, S03E11, O'Neill and Woolsey, the lone survivors of the replicators' bloody coup, hide out in an abandoned section of the city. Knowing Landry has an order to nuke Atlantis if a foothold situation should ever arise, the two lay low awaiting their fate.

programme.title: Twin Destinies
programme.desc: Stargate Universe, S02E12, Excitement spreads through the ship as Eli believes he’s found a way to dial Earth. But Dr. Rush has serious reservations about abandoning Destiny, and when the crew is interrupted by a distress call, it may just change the plans of the Destiny.

programme.title: Alliances
programme.desc: Stargate Universe, S02E13, Greer and Wray find themselves trapped in the midst of an attack when an alien ship carrying a radioactive bomb crashes into Homeworld Command. Meanwhile, Rush (Robert Carlyle) discovers that not everyone wants Greer and Wray back aboard Destiny.

programme.title: Hope
programme.desc: Stargate Universe, S02E14, While connected to the stones in an attempt to contact Homeworld Command, Chloe wakes up with Ginn’s consciousness. Eli must find a way to protect Chloe without losing Ginn. Meanwhile, Volker requires a difficult operation to save his life.

programme.title: Seizure
programme.desc: Stargate Universe, S02E15, Homeworld Command tries to convince an ally they suspect might be infiltrated by the Lucian Alliance to let them use their planet to power up and dial Destiny. Meanwhile, Rush is trapped in a simulation created by Amanda Perry.

programme.title: Zero Hour
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S08E04, O'Neill deals with a visit from the president and negotiations between two warring tribes from Amra. When SG-1 is captured, he's forced to choose between the safety of the team and the fate of a planet, making him question his competency!

programme.title: Icon
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S08E05, On a distant planet the Stargate has become a symbol to the people, and some believe that the gods will return through it to reward the faithful. SG-1 realizes that those gods are the Goa'uld and warn of the danger they may face.

programme.title: Avatar
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S08E06, The team agrees that an easy VR simulator is a useless training tool against the Goa'uld. Teal'c lets it learn from him, but as he plays, the game sends a shock each time he dies, and if he doesn't defeat the game, the chair will kill him.

programme.title: Affinity
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S08E07, Teal'c, having finally been cleared to live off-base, settles into his new neighborhood. His neighbors love him. He's quiet and he has become a sort of protector of his community but not everybody is as pleased about Teal'c's civilian assimilation.

programme.title: Covenant
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S08E08, Alec Colson is claiming he has shocking proof that the government is covering up a liaison with aliens, and that Earth was almost destroyed by an alien invasion, Colson gives all nations involved 24 hours to come clean or he'll do it for them.

programme.title: Sacrifices
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S08E09, Teal'c and Bra'tac have just returned from the planet Ha'ktyl, where they tried to convince the warrior-woman rebel leader Ishta, to wait until her fellow insurgent Jaffa grow numerous enough to wage war against all the Goa'uld system lords at once.

programme.title: Endgame
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S08E10, The Stargate is missing. Upon investigation the team notice a scientist tagging the stargate with a locator beacon. It looks like this is the work of The Trust taking whatever ruthless action they deem necessary to protect Earth from alien invaders.

programme.title: Gemini
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S08E11, An old IDC comes through; Send M.A.L.P. The M.A.L.P. telemetry shows that the person sending the transmission is Carter but Carter is in the control room at SGC. The Carter on the other side explains that she is a Replicator.

programme.title: Prometheus Unbound
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S08E12, A mission has been greenlit to take the Prometheus to the Pegasus galaxy. Jackson wants in. O'Neill feels he is too valuable to risk. The decision is overridden by the mission commander, none other than Gen. Hammond, now head of home world security.

programme.title: It's Good To Be King
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S08E13, Hoping to warn Harry Maybourne of Goa'uld attacks, SG-1 arrives at his last known whereabouts to find that he has been appointed king of a primitive people and believes he possesses writings by a time-traveling Ancient predicting these events.

programme.title: Full Alert
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S08E14, When O'Neill finds the door to his home forced open and former Vice President Kinsey waiting for him inside, his first instinct is to call the police. But he allies himself with Kinsey when he learns of a rogue organization known as The Trust.

programme.title: Citizen Joe
programme.desc: Stargate SG-1, S08E15, At a tag sale, civilian Joe Spencer comes across a small stone that gives him visions of SG-1 in action. Delighted, he shares the stories with anyone who will listen. But when he learns that SG-1 really exists, his excitement turns into obsession.

programme.desc: Baywatch, S09E05, A mysterious lifeguard makes rescues around Baywatch, then vanishes. After going over Mitch's head one too many times, Alex gets an annoying new partner.

programme.title: Drop Zone
programme.desc: Baywatch, S09E06, April suffers PTSD after losing a rescue victim. Mitch and the victim's widow refused to give up searching for his body. Jessie runs into an old beau who could undermine her future at Baywatch.

programme.title: Hot Summer Night
programme.desc: Baywatch, S09E07, Hobie struggles with his irresponsible actions leading to a boating accident that leaves a girl in a coma. Jessie is gripped with fear after April tells her of a recent, job-related tragedy.

programme.title: Swept Away
programme.desc: Baywatch, S09E08, Mitch befriends a boy who joins junior lifeguards in hopes of escaping a brutal home life. Jessie makes a passionate play for JD. Alex auditions for “Jeopardy!”

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: Baywatch, S09E09, Upset about his failed marriage to Neely, Mitch goes for a day-long tower swim along the beach and encounters problems that distract from his own, including April and Craig's May/December romance, and reluctant heroes Cody and JD.

programme.title: Friends Forever
programme.desc: Baywatch, S09E10, A young, hearing-impaired girl learns a lesson in friendship when she, Mitch and Alex protect an orangutan, while Cody and Jessie deal with its abusive owner.

programme.title: The Edge
programme.desc: Baywatch, S09E11, Cody puts his career, and his life, on the line when he uses a performance-enhancing supplement in hopes of making the Olympic swim team. Alex becomes the object of Mitch's rejection, and Newmie's affection.

programme.title: The Big Blue
programme.desc: Baywatch, S09E12, Mitch tries to reunite an Army parachutist with her estranged Naval-officer father, while Cody helps a beautiful woman try to reach record-setting depths at a national free-diving competition.

programme.title: Come Fly with Me
programme.desc: Baywatch, S09E13, After he tries to save Tanner from his abusive father, Mitch ends up on the wrong side of the law. Meanwhile, Jessie's irresistible charm makes a stunt pilot's heart take flight.

programme.title: Boys will be Boys
programme.desc: Baywatch, S09E14, When caught up in a high-risk adventure at sea, Craig tells Mitch a shocking secret. Meanwhile, Jessie works to creatively end JD and Cody's rivalry during a beachside triathlon, and April comes clean with Manny.

programme.title: Baywatch Grand Prix
programme.desc: Baywatch, S09E15, Mitch feels the need for speed when Tanner's cousin, Damon Lusk, a race car driver in town for a major competition, visits Baywatch. Meanwhile, Newmie and the gang develop a TV show about lifeguards that they try to sell it into syndication.

programme.title: Baywatch Down Under, Part 1
programme.desc: Baywatch, S09E16, After Mitch's lifeguard buddy's ex-wife dies in Australia, Mitch and the team accompany him on a trip down under to meet the son he's never known.

programme.title: Baywatch Down Under, Part 2
programme.desc: Baywatch, S09E17, While team Baywatch prepares to compete against the Australian guards, Jake must choose between staying down under with his son or returning home. The competing lifeguards must put their intense rivalry aside to save a life.
